critique: This document pertains to the withdrawal of public lands in California from settlement, location, sale, entry, and all forms of appropriation, pending a resurvey. It cites specific acts of Congress as its authority. Given the nature of the document, it is difficult to assess its position on the traditional left-right political spectrum. There's no clear indication of the document's stance on immigration. The order itself doesn't obviously expand executive power, as it is based on existing legislation. The document's impact on federalism is not significant. It doesn't directly address national security or civil liberties. The document involves government intervention in land use, but it's not a broad economic regulation. The document does not directly address social inclusion.
